ko.explanation: 사람들이 돈을 벌기 위해 일하는 조직. 상업 활동을 하는 법인 단체.

en.explanation: An organization where people work to earn money. A corporate entity engaged in commercial activities.

examples.beginner: 회사에 가요. - I'm going to the company/work.
examples.intermediate: 어느 회사 다니세요? - Which company do you work for?
examples.advanced: "How's work life?" "Good, my colleagues are all nice."
examples.master: Our company is an IT firm.

ko.explanation: 사무를 보는 방이나 공간. 회사에서 일하는 곳.

en.explanation: A room or space where office work is done. The place where you work in a company.

examples.beginner: 사무실에 있어요. - I'm at the office.
examples.intermediate: 사무실이 넓어요. - The office is spacious.
examples.advanced: "Where are you?" "I'm working at the office."
examples.master: We moved to a new office.

ko.explanation: 여러 사람이 모여 의견을 나누는 것. 업무에 대해 논의하는 모임.

en.explanation: When multiple people gather to share opinions. A gathering to discuss work matters.

examples.beginner: 회의 중이에요. - I'm in a meeting.
examples.intermediate: 회의가 길어요. - The meeting is long.
examples.advanced: "Do you have a meeting this afternoon?" "Yeah, I have a team meeting at 2."

ko.explanation: 직장에서 나보다 높은 직급에 있는 사람. 보스, 팀장, 부장 등.

en.explanation: A person with a higher position than you at work. Manager, team leader, director, etc.

examples.beginner: 상사가 엄격해요. - My boss is strict.
examples.intermediate: 상사와 회의했어요. - I had a meeting with my boss.
examples.advanced: "Did you report to your boss?" "Not yet, I'll do it now."

ko.explanation: 같은 직장에서 함께 일하는 사람. 같은 팀이나 부서의 직원.

en.explanation: A person you work with at the same workplace. An employee in the same team or department.

examples.beginner: 동료들이 친절해요. - My colleagues are kind.
examples.intermediate: 동료와 점심 먹었어요. - I had lunch with a colleague.
examples.advanced: "A new colleague joined." "What are they like?"
examples.master: I had dinner with my coworkers.

ko.explanation: 맡아서 처리해야 할 일. 직장에서 해야 하는 일이나 책임.

en.explanation: Work that needs to be handled. Jobs or responsibilities at the workplace.

examples.beginner: 업무가 많아요. - I have a lot of work.
examples.advanced: "What kind of work do you do?" "I'm in charge of marketing."
examples.master: When work is busy, I work overtime.

ko.explanation: 인터넷으로 주고받는 편지. 전자 우편.

en.explanation: A letter sent and received over the internet. Electronic mail.

examples.beginner: 이메일 보냈어요. - I sent an email.
examples.intermediate: 이메일 확인해 주세요. - Please check your email.
examples.advanced: "Did you get the email?" "Yeah, I just checked it."
examples.master: Please send important information via email.

ko.explanation: 목소리로 대화하는 통신 수단. 전화기를 통해 먼 곳에 있는 사람과 이야기한다.

en.explanation: A communication device for voice conversation. Talk to someone far away through a telephone.

examples.beginner: 전화 왔어요. - There's a phone call. / You have a call.
examples.intermediate: 전화 좀 할게요. - I'll make a phone call.
examples.advanced: "Answer the phone!" "Okay, I'll answer it now."
examples.master: I made a reservation by phone.

ko.explanation: 조사하거나 연구한 내용을 정리한 문서. 업무 결과를 정리해서 제출하는 글.

en.explanation: A document organizing research or study results. A written summary of work results to be submitted.

examples.beginner: 보고서 작성 중이에요. - I'm writing a report.
examples.intermediate: 보고서 제출했어요. - I submitted the report.
examples.advanced: "When is the report due?" "I have to submit it by Friday."

ko.explanation: 일을 끝내야 하는 기한. 제출 기한이나 완료 시한.

en.explanation: The time limit by which work must be completed. Submission deadline or completion time limit.

examples.beginner: 마감이 내일이에요. - The deadline is tomorrow.
examples.intermediate: 마감 시간이 촉박해요. - The deadline is tight.
examples.advanced: "When is the deadline?" "By Friday this week."
examples.master: We need to work overnight to meet the deadline.

ko.explanation: 1년 동안 받는 급여. 연간 총 임금.

en.explanation: Salary received over one year. Total annual wages.

examples.advanced: "Did you get a raise?" "Yes, a 5% increase."

ko.explanation: 한 달에 한 번 받는 급여. 매달 지급되는 임금.

en.explanation: Salary received once a month. Wages paid every month.

examples.master: I pay living expenses with my salary.

ko.explanation: 직장에 가는 것. 아침에 회사에 도착하는 것.

en.explanation: Going to the workplace. Arriving at the company in the morning.

examples.intermediate: What time do you go to work?
examples.advanced: "What time do you start work?" "9 o'clock."
examples.master: I work from home so I don't need to commute.

ko.explanation: 일을 끝내고 집에 가는 것. 회사를 떠나는 것.

en.explanation: Finishing work and going home. Leaving the company.

examples.intermediate: What time do you get off work?
examples.advanced: "What are you doing after work?" "Going home to rest."

ko.explanation: 밤늦게까지 일하는 것. 정규 퇴근 시간 이후에 일하는 것.

en.explanation: Working until late at night. Working after regular hours.

examples.intermediate: I work a lot of overtime.

ko.explanation: 일을 쉬는 기간. 회사에서 허락한 쉬는 날.

en.explanation: A period of rest from work. Days off allowed by the company.

examples.master: How many annual leave days do you have left?

ko.explanation: 직접 만나서 질문을 받는 것. 취업할 때 회사에서 인터뷰하는 것.

en.explanation: Meeting in person to answer questions. Being interviewed by a company when job hunting.

examples.advanced: "How was the interview?" "I was nervous but I think it went well."

ko.explanation: 자신의 경력과 학력을 쓴 문서. 취업할 때 제출하는 서류.

en.explanation: A document listing your experience and education. Submitted when job hunting.

examples.advanced: "Where do I submit my resume?" "You can email it."
examples.master: Prepare your resume and cover letter.

ko.explanation: 직장을 구해서 일을 시작하는 것. 회사에 들어가는 것.

en.explanation: Finding a job and starting work. Joining a company.

examples.intermediate: I'm preparing to get a job.
examples.advanced: "When will you get a job?" "I'm working hard on it."
examples.master: My dream is to work at a big company.

ko.explanation: 회사를 그만두는 것. 직장을 떠나는 것.

en.explanation: Quitting a company. Leaving a job.

examples.advanced: "Why are you resigning?" "I want to try something new."

ko.explanation: 직급이 올라가는 것. 더 높은 직책으로 오르는 것.

en.explanation: Moving up in rank. Rising to a higher position.

examples.advanced: "I heard you got promoted?" "Yes, I'm a team leader now."
examples.master: I want to work hard and get promoted.

ko.explanation: 계획적으로 진행하는 일. 팀이 함께 하는 업무.

en.explanation: A planned task. Work done together as a team.

examples.master: I was assigned to a major project.

ko.explanation: 사람들 앞에서 설명하는 것. 프레젠테이션.

en.explanation: Explaining in front of people. A presentation.

examples.intermediate: You did well on the presentation.

ko.explanation: 약속을 문서로 정하는 것. 서로 지켜야 할 내용을 적은 것.

en.explanation: Making a promise official through a document. Writing terms both parties must follow.

ko.explanation: 사업상 거래하는 회사. 파트너 회사.

en.explanation: A company you do business with. Partner company.

examples.advanced: "Do you have the client's contact?" "Yes, I'll send it."
examples.master: I found a new business partner.

ko.explanation: 물건이나 서비스를 사는 사람. 손님.

en.explanation: A person who buys goods or services. A customer.

examples.master: It's important to increase customer satisfaction.

ko.explanation: 팀을 이끄는 사람. 팀의 리더.

en.explanation: The person who leads a team. The team's leader.

examples.beginner: The team leader called for me.
examples.master: I feel responsibility as team leader.

ko.explanation: 부서를 관리하는 직급. 팀장보다 높은 직위.

en.explanation: A position that manages a department. Higher than team leader.

examples.advanced: "Did you get the manager's approval?" "Yes, I did."
examples.master: My goal is to be promoted to manager.

ko.explanation: 회사의 대표. 회사를 이끄는 최고 책임자.

en.explanation: The representative of a company. The head of the company.

examples.intermediate: I'm going to meet the president.
examples.advanced: "The CEO is on a business trip today." "Oh, really?"
examples.master: I want to become a CEO someday.

ko.explanation: 업무를 위해 다른 곳에 가는 것. 회사 일로 여행하는 것.

en.explanation: Going somewhere for work. Traveling for company business.

examples.beginner: I went on a business trip.
examples.master: I have many overseas business trips.

ko.explanation: 집에서 일하는 것. 원격 근무.

en.explanation: Working from home. Remote work.

examples.advanced: "Can I work from home?" "Yes, 2 days a week."

ko.explanation: 회사 사람들끼리 함께 하는 식사. 직장 회식.

en.explanation: A meal together with coworkers. Office dinner gathering.

examples.beginner: We have a work dinner today.
examples.advanced: "Are you going to the work dinner?" "Yes, I'll go."

ko.explanation: 회사를 나눈 단위. 마케팅부, 영업부 등.

examples.advanced: "부서 이동하고 싶어?" "응, 다른 일 해 보고 싶어."

en.explanation: A division of a company. Marketing, sales, etc.

examples.advanced: "Do you want to change departments?" "Yes, I want to try different work."

ko.explanation: 새로 들어온 사람. 새로운 직원.

en.explanation: A person who just joined. A new staff member.

ko.explanation: 일한 경험. 직장 생활의 이력.

en.explanation: Work experience. History of work life.

examples.advanced: "I applied as an experienced hire." "What's your experience?"

ko.explanation: 전자 계산기. 업무용 기기.

en.explanation: An electronic device. Work equipment.

examples.advanced: "Is the computer broken?" "Yes, I requested service."

ko.explanation: 전 세계를 연결하는 통신망. 업무에 필수적인 도구.

en.explanation: A global communication network. Essential tool for work.

examples.master: It's hard to work without internet.

ko.explanation: 컴퓨터에 저장된 문서. 디지털 문서.

en.explanation: A document stored on a computer. Digital document.

examples.master: I saved the file to the cloud.

ko.explanation: 문서를 인쇄하는 기기. 출력 장치.

en.explanation: A device that prints documents. Output device.

examples.advanced: "The printer is out of paper." "I'll add some."
examples.master: We need to replace the printer ink.

ko.explanation: 문서를 똑같이 만드는 것. 복사기로 사본을 만드는 것.

en.explanation: Making an identical document. Making copies with a copier.

ko.explanation: 금액을 계산해서 정리하는 것. 비용을 처리하는 것.

en.explanation: Calculating and organizing amounts. Processing expenses.

examples.advanced: "When is the travel expense due?" "By this week."

ko.explanation: 미리 정한 돈. 사업이나 프로젝트에 쓸 돈.

en.explanation: Pre-determined money. Money for business or projects.

examples.advanced: "The budget is short." "Should we request more?"

ko.explanation: 물건을 팔아서 얻은 돈. 판매 수익.

en.explanation: Money earned from selling. Sales revenue.

examples.advanced: "Did you meet the sales target?" "Almost there."

ko.explanation: 물건이나 서비스를 파는 활동. 고객을 만나 거래하는 것.

en.explanation: Activity of selling goods or services. Meeting customers and making deals.

ko.explanation: 상품이나 서비스를 홍보하는 활동. 광고하고 판매 촉진하는 것.

en.explanation: Activity of promoting products or services. Advertising and sales promotion.

examples.advanced: "How's the marketing campaign?" "I think it'll be effective."
examples.master: I'm in charge of digital marketing.

ko.explanation: 새로운 일을 계획하고 준비하는 것. 아이디어를 구체화하는 과정.

en.explanation: Planning and preparing new work. Process of making ideas concrete.

examples.master: I'm in charge of new product planning.

ko.explanation: 새로운 것을 만드는 것. 프로그램이나 제품을 만드는 활동.

en.explanation: Creating something new. Activity of making programs or products.

ko.explanation: 직원 채용과 관리를 담당하는 부서. HR 부서.

en.explanation: Department responsible for hiring and managing employees. Human Resources.

examples.intermediate: I got a call from HR.
examples.advanced: "Do you know the HR person?" "Yes, I'll introduce you."

ko.explanation: 회의를 하는 방. 업무 논의를 하는 공간.

en.explanation: A room for meetings. Space for discussing work.

examples.advanced: "Is the meeting room free?" "It's in use now."
examples.master: The presentation is in the large conference room.

ko.explanation: 회사에서 일하는 사람. 직장인.

en.explanation: A person who works at a company. Office worker.

examples.master: This company has good employee benefits.
